title.value: ON THE STABILITY OF A NON-HYPERBOLIC NONLINEAR MAP WITH NON-BOUNDED SET OF NON-ISOLATED FIXED POINTS WITH APPLICATIONS TO MACHINE LEARNING
title.justification: This is the title of the paper.
title.quote: ON THE STABILITY OF A NON-HYPERBOLIC NONLINEAR MAP WITH NON-BOUNDED SET OF NON-ISOLATED FIXED POINTS WITH APPLICATIONS TO MACHINE LEARNING

extractions.description: This paper deals with the convergence analysis of the SUCPA (Semi Unsupervised Calibration through Prior Adaptation) algorithm, defined from a first-order non-linear difference equations, first developed to correct the scores output by a supervised machine learning classifier.

type.justification: The paper focuses on proving the convergence of an algorithm, which is a theoretical contribution.
type.quote: This paper deals with the convergence analysis of the SUCPA (Semi Unsupervised Calibration through Prior Adaptation) algorithm, defined from a first-order non-linear difference equations, first developed to correct the scores output by a supervised machine learning classifier.

name.justification: The paper focuses on calibrating machine learning models, which is a key aspect of machine learning.
name.quote: This paper deals with the convergence analysis of the SUCPA (Semi Unsupervised Calibration through Prior Adaptation) algorithm, defined from a first-order non-linear difference equations, first developed to correct the scores output by a supervised machine learning classifier.

name.justification: The paper deals with the calibration of machine learning models, which is a key aspect of probabilistic machine learning.
name.quote: Particularly in the case of probabilistic machine learning classifiers, the training set is used to obtain a so called posterior probability distribution P (y|x) over the set Y = {y1 , . . . , yK } of possible categories, for each possible input x.

name.justification: The paper studies the SUCPA algorithm.
name.quote: This paper deals with the convergence analysis of the SUCPA (Semi Unsupervised Calibration through Prior Adaptation) algorithm, defined from a first-order non-linear difference equations, first developed to correct the scores output by a supervised machine learning classifier.

is_contributed.justification: The authors of this paper are also authors on the original SUCPA paper.
is_contributed.quote: In recent work, we proposed the SUCPA algorithm to address the scenario of mismatched priors for text classification tasks solved with large language models [12].

is_executed.justification: The paper shows results of SUCPA applied to different NLP datasets.
is_executed.quote: Numerical experiments on real-world application are performed to support the theoretical results by means of two different classification problems: Sentiment Polarity performed with a Large Language Model and Cat-Dog Image classification.

is_compared.justification: The paper studies the SUCPA algorithm in the context of calibrating language models, which are not compared to other models in this work.
is_compared.quote: In recent work, we proposed the SUCPA algorithm to address the scenario of mismatched priors for text classification tasks solved with large language models [12].

referenced_paper_title.value: Unsupervised calibration through prior adaptation for text classification using large language models
referenced_paper_title.justification: The authors mention that SUCPA was proposed in their recent work.
referenced_paper_title.quote: In recent work, we proposed the SUCPA algorithm to address the scenario of mismatched priors for text classification tasks solved with large language models [12].
